blackengine.application

Class ApplicationManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • blackengine.application.ApplicationManager

  • public abstract class ApplicationManager
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of this abstract class will manage the outside of the entire application.

    • Method Detail

      • getDisplayManager

        public DisplayManager getDisplayManager()
        Getter for the display manager.
        Returns:
        The display manager that is responsible for updating the display, as well as driving the master renderer.

      • setDisplayManager

        public void setDisplayManager(DisplayManager displayManager)
        Setter for the display manager.
        Parameters:
        displayManager - An implementation of DisplayManager that will be responsible for updating the display, as well as driving the master renderer.

      • getGameManager

        public GameManager getGameManager()
        Getter for the game manager.
        Returns:
        The game manager that is responsible for handling all game state updates.

      • setGameManager

        public void setGameManager(GameManager gameManager)
        Setter for the game manager.
        Parameters:
        gameManager - An implementation of GameManager that will be responsible for handling all game state updates.

      • getInputManager

        public InputManager getInputManager()
        Getter for the input manager.
        Returns:
        The input manager that is responsible for handling all inputs and making sure that all elements of the application that are subscribed to an input event will be notified.

      • setInputManager

        public void setInputManager(InputManager inputManager)
        Setter for the input manager.
        Parameters:
        inputManager - An implementation of InputManager that will be responsible for handling all inputs and making sure that all elements of the application that are subscribed to an input event will be notified.

      • startApplication

        public void startApplication()
        Starts a new application by calling an implementation of the abstract setUp method, followed by the game loop and finally an implementation of the abstract cleanUp method.

        The game loop itself can be stopped by calling the quit method or by requesting to close on the display itself. In both cases, the current iteration will complete, and will be followed by calling an implementation of the abstract cleanUp method.

        The loop consists of three main parts, in order:
        • Have the InputManager handle all keyboard and mouse input.
        • Have the GameManager handle state updates to the scene and/or user interface.
        • Have the DisplayManager handle all rendering and updating of the display.

      • runLater

        public void runLater(java.lang.Runnable runnable)
        Runs the provided runnable at the end of this frame.
        Parameters:
        runnable - The runnable to be run at the end of this frame.

      • quit

        public void quit()
        Will break the game loop once this iteration has finished.

      • setUp

        public abstract void setUp()
        Will contain all logic that will have to be run before the game loop is started.

      • cleanUp

        public abstract void cleanUp()
        Will contain all logic that will have to be run after the game loop has ended.
